thread.title: Commando 2 teaser poster: Vidyut Jammwal’s ‘blindfolded’ act looks mysterious but is quite unoriginal
thread.title_full: Commando 2 teaser poster: Vidyut Jammwal’s ‘blindfolded’ act looks mysterious but is quite unoriginal

author: Sreeju Sudhakaran
title: Commando 2 teaser poster: Vidyut Jammwal’s ‘blindfolded’ act looks mysterious but is quite unoriginal

organizations.name: india international jewellery week  vidyut jammwal

text:
Karisma Kapoor walks the ramp for India International Jewellery Week 
Vidyut Jammwal , the man who quite impressed as the main antagonist in the first Force movie, had a sleeper hit in Commando nearly four years ago. The movie, directed by Dilip Ghosh and produced by Vipul Shah, had the martial arts specialist with a ripped body to boast off play a military commando who has to protect an annoying girl (Pooja Chopra) from the clutched of baddies lied by the very talented Jaideep Ahlawat. Surprisingly, Vidyut was not seen much in Bollywood movies after that, with only a supporting role in Saif Ali Khan’s Bullett Raja and Suriya’s Tamil film Anjaan , where he again had a supporting role, to speak of. Now in 2017, his much delayed sequel to Commando is ready to release, produced by Vipul Amrutlal Shah. 
However there will be changes in the sequel, as in the movie will be directed by Deven Bhojani, known for playing Aamir Khan’s best friend in Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar and Rishi Kapoor’s son in Agneepath , as well for directing popular comedy shows on television like Sarabhai vs Sarabhai and Sumit Sambhal Lega . It will be interesting to see when how he will handle action for the first time. The heroine will be played by Adah Sharma. Freddy Daruwala, the main antagonist in Akshay Kumar’s Holiday and Esha Gupta are touted to be the villains in the movie. 
Recently they released the first teaser poster of the movie, that you can see above. It’s mysterious for sure, as you wonder, while Vidyut is blindfolded with dollars. But it is also not original as well, as it is clearly inspired by the popular poster for the video game, Homefront…. 
Interestingly, the same idea was taken for the first look posters of the Saif Ali Khan – Katrina Kaif starrer, Phantom…
